item.title: PtRu Alloys as Active Nitrate Reduction Electrocatalysts
item.description:
Aqueous nitrate (NO3–) ions are one of the world’s most widespread water pollutants, and present significant health and environmental concerns. Remediation approaches such as bacterial consumption (i.e., biological nitrate reduction) and ion-exchange (i.e., physical separation) are widespread and scalable, but have significant drawbacks. For example, biological reduction is infeasible for wastewater streams containing heavy metals, as these can poison the bacteria, and physical separation methods produce a concentrated nitrate brine stream which must then be stored or processed.

Electrocatalytic nitrate reduction (NO3RR)
